summary: This is a system-generated notice from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding a defective document filing in the case United States v. Maxwell. The notice indicates that an acknowledgment and notice of appearance filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell was defective.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the appellant in the case United States of America v. Maxwell, and a defective notice of appearance was filed on her behalf.

events.title: Defective Document Filing Notice
events.description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals issued a notice that an acknowledgment and notice of appearance filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell was defective.

keyFacts: The document is a notice from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding a defective filing in case 21-770, United States v. Maxwell.
The defective document was an acknowledgment and notice of appearance filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell.
The notice was generated and filed electronically on April 5, 2021.
